H0.text: What holds the greatest volume of fresh water on Earth. Oceans

H1.text: What holds the greatest volume of fresh water on Earth. Lakes

H2.text: What holds the greatest volume of fresh water on Earth. Rivers

H3.text: What holds the greatest volume of fresh water on Earth. Glaciar

A4.text: This ice is equivalent to around 61% of all fresh water on Earth.

A5.text: The Antarctic ice sheet covers an area of almost 14 million square kilometres and contains 26.5 million cubic kilometres of ice.
